title: Custom Work
content: I've just about given up on my search for a perfect typeface (for a logo project), and am now considering custom work. Can you guys give me some feedback as to where to go, what to expect (budget-wise), and how to start?
author: sperte

comments.content:
Do you mean custon lettering for just the logo, or the whole typeface?  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Personal Art and Design Portal of Ivan Gulkov  
 [www.ivangdesign.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018072653/http:/www.ivangdesign.com/ "www.ivangdesign.com")
Write up and RFP and send it to some type designers/lettering artists who draw the sort of letters that you’re looking for.

I'm thinking custom lettering just for the logo — but will be selecting a couple of typefaces for use in conjunction with the logo; ones that compliment it well.

How about a list of recommended artists or foundries?
We do this sort of work all the time. Gives us a call and we will be happy to discuss the details with you.
a partial list, which includes James and others who create Custom Letters, is at LetterCult [HERE](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018072653/http:/www.lettercult.com/lettermakers)
